name: Travellers with <Status> level should earn <Bonus> bonus points

testSteps.description: 1: Travellers with STANDARD level should earn 0 bonus points ({Status=STANDARD, Points Earned=100, Bonus=0})

children.description: Given Trevor is a Frequent Flyer Member with status STANDARD
And he has logged onto the Frequent Flyer application
he logs in as trevor1386213550@traveller.com
he goes to the login page
he opens the pages.home page
he clicks on Login button
he enters 'trevor1386213550@traveller.com' into Email field
he enters 'tr3vor' into Password field
he clicks on Login button
he expects to see a message of 'Logged in as trevor1386213550@traveller.com'
he should see Success message with text content that is equal to: <"Logged in as trevor1386213550@traveller.com">
he clicks on Success message
When he books an Economy flight from Sydney to Hong Kong
He search flights
he goes to the Book FLights page
he opens the pages.home page
he clicks on Book Flights button
he enters 'Sydney',TAB into From field
he enters 'Hong Kong',TAB into To field
he selects  'Economy' from Travel Class dropdown
he clicks on Travel Class dropdown
he clicks on option
he clicks on Search button
he books the first available flight
he clicks on From field
he acknowledges the success notification message
he clicks on Success message
Then he should earn 100 points
he goes to the My Accounts page
he clicks on My Account button

userStory.narrative:
Frequent Flyers earn status points each time they fly.
  As they earn more points, their status level increases and they get more benefits.

title: Travellers with <Status> level should earn <Bonus> bonus points
description: A flight from Sydney to Hong Kong normally earns 100 points

rule.name: Travellers with higher status earn more points

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
Given Trevor is a Frequent Flyer Member with status <Status>
And he has logged onto the Frequent Flyer application
When he books an Economy flight from Sydney to Hong Kong
Then he should earn <Points Earned> points
